page.title: 18Rogart - Transport (Roads)
page.content: In Rogart there are four types of roads - A839, a main road; class 3 roads; unclassified roads; and unadopted roads. Altogether, there are 50 miles of road with 100 passing places. The surface of a road is made with tar and chips. The liquid tar seals any cracks in the existing tarmacadam and the chips stop the liquid tar from sticking to tyres. In the winter time, ice or a little snow melt when covered with a mixture of salt and sand. Deeper snow is cleared with a snowplough fitted onto an old army lorry. Very deep snow requires a blower. Sixteen men used to take care of the Rogart roads. Now, two do it; so they are always busy.
